text:
e="preserve">The People's National Assembly ("al-Majlis al-Sha'abi al-Watani") is the lower house of the Algerian Parliament. It is made of 462 members directly elected by the population. Of the 462 seats, 8 are reserved for Algerians living abroad.
Members of the People's National Assembly are directly elected through proportional representation in multiple-member districts and serve terms lasting five years at a time.
The minimum age required for election into the APN is 28.
